articles.headline: Intersectional Uprising Protest Empowers Bournemouth Residents
articles.author: Lewis Eyre
articles.story_classification_reasoning: This is a human interest story driven by the lived experiences of LGBTQ+ and activist community members sharing their personal motivations and experiences at a protest. The focus is on participants' voices and their personal journeys rather than institutional expertise.

beat_context.beat_reasoning: LGBTQ+ rights and activism is not a gendered beat - it requires diverse voices across gender identities

quoted_sources.name: Jadien Davies
quoted_sources.gender_reasoning: Name does not clearly indicate gender
quoted_sources.title: Event Organizer
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Davies organized this specific protest event and speaks from personal lived experience ('younger me', personal health difficulties). Cannot be replaced by another organizer - they are the internal participant who made this event happen.
quoted_sources.quote_context: Spoke about motivation for organizing, personal journey, and participant resilience despite verbal abuse

quoted_sources.name: Evelyn Eales
quoted_sources.gender_reasoning: Evelyn can be used as a name across genders; they/them pronouns used in article suggest non-binary identification
quoted_sources.title: Health and Safety Co-ordinator
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Eales coordinated safety for this specific event and speaks from position as touring musician affected by the issues. Not replaceable - internal participant with personal stake in the protest outcomes.
quoted_sources.quote_context: Emphasized importance of safety and the right for participants to exist and be heard

quoted_sources.name: Robin
quoted_sources.gender_reasoning: Single name provided, gender-neutral name, context indicates trans advocacy
quoted_sources.title: Speaker, Trans and Women's Rights Advocate
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Robin spoke at the event from personal lived experience of sexual harassment and as a member of the trans community. Their testimony is personal and irreplaceable - they are the affected party, not an external expert.
quoted_sources.quote_context: Shared personal testimony about experiencing sexual harassment as a child

stakeholder_groups.reasoning: Directly affected by rights issues, organized and participated in the march
Specific sub-community within LGBTQ+ facing existential threats to rights
Institutions being protested against for neglecting marginalized groups
Mentioned as source of verbal abuse; broader audience for protest message

articles.headline: Local care home combats loneliness on Blue Monday
articles.author: Justina Reynolds
articles.story_classification_reasoning: This story centers on lived experiences of loneliness in care settings, told through voices of care home staff and a resident. The focus is human interest and personal testimony about isolation rather than external institutional expertise.

beat_context.beat_reasoning: Care work and elder care is a gendered beat with workforce predominantly female; societal expectations associate caregiving with women

quoted_sources.name: Jess
quoted_sources.gender_reasoning: Jess is typically a feminine name (short for Jessica), and context of activities supporter role in care home aligns with gendered workforce patterns
quoted_sources.title: Activities Supporter at Branksome Heights
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Jess works directly at this specific care home providing activities to combat loneliness. She speaks from her lived experience in the role and cannot be replaced by an external expert - she is the internal participant implementing the solution.
quoted_sources.quote_context: Spoke about the reality of loneliness and her role in addressing it

quoted_sources.name: Karen
quoted_sources.title: Receptionist and Family Liaison
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Karen works at this specific care home in family liaison capacity and speaks from direct experience supporting families. Not replaceable - she is an internal participant with firsthand knowledge of family experiences at this facility.
quoted_sources.quote_context: Spoke about loneliness for family caregivers and importance of active social programming

quoted_sources.name: Barbara Adams
quoted_sources.title: Resident
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Barbara is a resident experiencing the care home's programming firsthand. Her lived experience of loneliness and social activities is irreplaceable - she is the affected party, not an expert observer.
quoted_sources.quote_context: Shared her positive experience participating in entertainment activities

stakeholder_groups.reasoning: Primary beneficiaries of loneliness interventions; experiencing isolation

stakeholder_groups.group: Care home staff and activities coordinators
stakeholder_groups.reasoning: Implementing programs to address loneliness; working directly with residents
Karen spoke on their behalf about their loneliness and emotional burden; indirect beneficiaries of care home socialization
Provide weekly programming but not directly quoted; enable social engagement

articles.headline: Boscombe community wears their visibility cloaks and gets poetical
articles.author: Naomi Kativu
articles.story_classification_reasoning: This is a human interest/arts and culture story focused on personal creative expression and lived experiences of local poets. The story centers on participants' voices and their relationship to poetry rather than institutional expertise.

beat_context.beat_reasoning: Arts, poetry, and creative community events are not gendered beats - they require diverse voices across genders

quoted_sources.name: Ri Baroche
quoted_sources.gender_reasoning: Ri is a gender-neutral name/nickname; article uses 'they' pronouns in some contexts suggesting possible non-binary identification
quoted_sources.title: Multidisciplinary artist, performer, musician, theatre maker, and poet
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Baroche was the featured performer at this specific event and speaks from lived creative experience and personal journey with poetry. They are not a replaceable external expert but the internal participant - the artist whose performance is being covered.
quoted_sources.quote_context: Spoke about personal relationship with poetry and value of Bournemouth's creative community

quoted_sources.name: Claire Hillier
quoted_sources.gender_reasoning: Claire is a feminine name; referred to as 'Claire H the Poet'
quoted_sources.title: Poet (Claire H the Poet)
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Hillier is a local poet who performs at these events and speaks from lived experience as a Bournemouth creative. She is not replaceable - she is an internal participant in the local poetry scene sharing personal connection to the community.
quoted_sources.quote_context: Spoke about sense of belonging in the community and poetry's power to convey human experience

stakeholder_groups.reasoning: Featured participants creating and sharing work at the event
Community members participating as audience, including those reading from local poetry books
Hosts the weekly event; provides platform for community gathering
